key_commands.description: List all pods in the namespace to verify components are running.
List all services and their ports to identify candidates for connectivity issues.
Check frontend logs for any surface errors related to downstream connectivity.
Inspect user-service logs to confirm the service starts without obvious runtime errors.
Inspect compose-post-service logs showing connection refused to user-service:9090, indicating a potential port mismatch.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints user-service -n test-social-network -o wide")
key_commands.description: Check user-service Endpoints to see the actual backend port exposed (shows 10.244.1.56:9999), revealing a mismatch.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints user-service -n test-social-network -o wide")

key_commands.description: Describe user-service deployment to verify the container's declared port (9090), supporting the mismatch diagnosis.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc user-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Retrieve user-service Service YAML confirming misconfigured targetPort: 9999.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc user-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")

key_commands.description: Cross-check all services' port to targetPort mappings; confirms only user-service maps 9090->9999.
Submit the identified faulty component (user-service) due to Service targetPort misconfiguration.
